data.title: html help compiler runs, but gives error saying it failed
data.body:
Docs build otherwise, but I get the following error:
69>CUSTOMBUILD : error : failed to run html help compiler on index.hhp

build\Urho3D\Docs\Doxyfile contains:
HHC_LOCATION           = "C:/Program Files (x86)/HTML Help Workshop/hhc.exe"

This is correct, it actually exists on my machine.  It was substituted from CMake HTML_HELP_COMPILER variable.  I notice however that I have HTML_HELP_INCLUDE_PATH-NOTFOUND and HTML_HELP_LIBRARY-NOTFOUND.

System is Windows 10 64-bit, Visual Studio 2015 Community Edition, Windows 10 SDK.  CMake version 3.2.3, generator is VS 2015 64-bit.

data.title: CMake user should be told dot / Graphviz is required for doc generation
data.body:
Doxygen does not ship with "dot" nowadays.  It is contained in Graphviz.  "dot" is searched for by the CMake build, but when it is not found, that information is not passed along to the user.  This results in a spectacular failure later if the user tries to build the docs, where "dot" actually seems to be present and working for up to 150 lines of output, followed by a similarly large number of barfs.  Abbreviated example, please extrapolate:

3>  Running dot for graph 515/957
...
3>  Running dot for graph 651/957
3>CUSTOMBUILD : error : Problems running dot: exit code=-1, command='dot', arguments='"C:/Users/bvanevery/devel/build/Urho3D/Docs/html/struct_urho3_d_1_1_spriter_1_1_timeline_key__inherit__graph.dot" -Tpng -o "C:/Users/bvanevery/devel/build/Urho3D/Docs/html/struct_urho3_d_1_1_spriter_1_1_timeline_key__inherit__graph.png"'
[similar repeated lots of times]

Don't have a fix but here are principles of how it should behave:
- when "dot" is missing, user should be informed that "dot" is required to build docs, that it is usually available in Graphviz, and a link given to Graphviz website.
- if user doesn't say they want to build docs, then failure to find "dot" should be a warning
- if user explicitly says they want to build docs, then failure to find "dot" should be an error
- doc generation should never be QUIET.  It should either happen or not happen.  If the user doesn't like piles of doc messages or extra build time during routine builds then they should just not routinely build the docs.  Some dependency issues could be exacerbating the noisiness here.

data.title: doc build dependency doesn't work in Visual Studio
data.body:
In Visual Studio 2015 Community Edition, when I build the "doc" target before building anything else in the solution, it fails because build\Urho3D\bin\tool\ScriptCompiler doesn't exist yet.  A dependency on ScriptCompiler should exist.  weitjong cannot reproduce the problem in a Makefile based build on a non-Windows system (probably Linux).  The expected dependencies are:
  doc -> ScriptAPI.dox -> Urho3D & ScriptCompiler
and weitjong says it works on his system.  I haven't checked a non-Windows system of my own yet.

data.title: Update Angelscript to 2.30.2
data.body:
This pull request updates Angelscript to 2.30.2.

All angelscript samples have been checked. Editor functions but is likely not covered in entirety.

**Notes:**
- Binding ref/value casts has changed, will effect any custom bindings that do not use APITemplates methods
- new protected scope
- private scope changed, now truly private (was previously really protected)
- anonymous methods
- bug-fixes

data.title: ConvexCast doesn't take into account Urho3D::CollisionShape position
data.body:
ConvexCast() doesn't take into account Urho3D::CollisionShape position.
That causes the shape to be cast not from where you'd expect it to.
The user can't really tell what's going on without inspecting and understanding the source code of ConvexCast().
By simply adding the shape's position to that start & end position the problem is solved.
The problem with this solution is that it will be a bit more expensive, and in most cases the position is zero, so it's wasteful.
To solve that we could have a version of the function that takes a shape's position into account. This way when the user will look at the documentation of ConvexCast he'll be able to find out  why things fail without having to figure out the source code. Maybe name it ConvexCastWithPosition().

data.title: Emscripten build attempts a call to nonfunctional popen.
data.body:
Running an Emscripten build with current Emscripten incoming, I am seeing that Urho3D has code that calls to `popen`. In Emscripten that function is not supported (there is no multiprocess capabilities). Current Emscripten had a bug that calls to that function would cause a call to unresolved symbol `posix_spawn` to be attempted. That will be fixed in https://github.com/kripken/emscripten/pull/3819 . After that, calls to `popen` will be no-ops that just return 0 and set errno.

Perhaps Urho3D should #ifdef out its code paths that lead to calling `popen` on Emscripten?

data.title: Update assimp
data.body:
This updates assimp to head revision from 15th September ( https://github.com/assimp/assimp/commit/e159728307f17888b8b3ab4f23cf2143562c1c10 )

Testing with real-world data would be appreciated. If there's a case where Assimp _still_ doesn't work correctly, we can't do much, but I'd like to hear at least if something used to work but stopped working with this new version.

On a technical front, assimp no longer seems to use PCH. I didn't attempt to bring this back in.

data.title: Export OBJ files from the Urho3D Editor
data.body:
This pull request adds OBJ export of either the entire scene or just the selected drawables to the editor. Includes normals and texture coordinates (TEXCOORD1) if present in the drawable's geometry. Doesn't write a material file yet (having trouble grokking that format) and all drawable's are written using their highest LOD. Special reminder: Blender ignores OBJ vertex normals.

Example uses:
- Send scene geometry to Houdini to do voodoo like flowmaps and such
- Use to aid in modeling a "fitted" model 
- Author animation for the actual space (ie. dreaded ladder rungs)
- Run analysis tools on it (vertex density "hotness," etc)
- Use for offline rendering
- Not great for combining geometry into a single static geometry (bad workflow for that), but can be used for it
- etc

I haven't been able to come up with a reason for this to be used outside of the Editor scenario, so there's no bindings for Lua. That would require refactoring the functions out to someplace else. I don't have a problem with making those changes though, just don't see a reason.

data.title: Network Host Migration Support
data.body: I have seen this used with other popular multiplayer games so aside from Client Side Prediction, I think transferring 'Host' status/mode during an active session to another 'Candidate' player with an acceptable ping rate (depending on the game) seems to be a good addition. This is particularly essential when the current host suddenly rage quits, drops out of the game or has some form of problem with his/her connection. The network session would run smoothly and avoid critical game play disruption.

data.title: Using Clang as library to create host tools for auto generation of bindings for scripting subsystems
data.body:
Plan tasks:
1. Create a new "throw-away" migration tool that analyses current hand-coded AngelScript bindings classes as input and produces annotated Urho3D library source files as output (probably push to a new branch). The annotation marks which classes and methods are currently exposed and which are not, which use external static functions, and so forth.
2. Create a new automatic binding generation tool that uses Clang to parse through the annotated C++ source files to extract the exposed class/enum/methods etc and uses Mustache templates to generate new source files for each officially supported script subsystems.

data.title: Animations cause asserts on exit
data.body:
Original forum thread: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/post8147.html

You can download a replication project from here:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/l4nhwaqxeu3xbuv/animation_bug.7z?dl=0
It's a modified "04_StaticScene.as".
Most of the bug code is in lines 69-89.

**How to replicate:**
Use the debug version "start_d.bat"
After the first animation ends and the second animation starts, exit the program by pressing ESC, and you should get asserts.

When playing the second animation, if it's the same as the first one it won't assert.
Maybe it has something to do with AnimationController's AnimationStates?

In my game it happens when I restart the level, which includes removing the scene's script instance.
In Urho3DPlayer it happens when you exit the program.
So maybe it has something to do with the script system?

data.title: Add cubemap generation capability to the Urho3D editor
data.body:
Addition of a command and associated settings for generating cubemaps in the Urho3D editor.

Cubemap sampling is performed at the position of the node containing a selected zone. This is deliberate as node position is considered to be the "true" position of the zone for sampling purposes. For other reasons a zone may need to reach substantially outside of this range (ie. into the sky), even though only a limited area is really relevant for cubemap generation.

During this process existing zones are disabled and duplicates are made matching their traits, this is deliberate to prevent doubling of anything that may depend on the Zone texture.

The added "GetImage" method to Texture2D in script is intended solely for editor usage. It is likely not sufficiently robust for general purpose usage.

Cubemaps are by default written to Data/Textures/Cubemaps/{SceneName}, and are named by the component ID of the zone. A name be prepended to the generated name for the purpose of generating multiple cubemaps for the same zones (night/day scenarios).

Settings for this process are available in the settings window.

data.title: Graphics::ResolveToTexture() doesn't support less than full screen viewports on D3D11.
data.body: D3D11 doesn't have an equivalent of StretchRect, which would allow to resolve part of the backbuffer to the texture. Therefore this has to be worked around with a manual drawcall-based copy.

data.title: Update 33_Urho2DSpriterAnimation.lua
data.body: animationIndex is changed to spriterAnimationIndex
